decision_conditions: The proposed loft conversion, with roof extending over proposed rear extension and incorporated side dormer window by virtue of its excessive scale, bulk, mass would appear incongruous, dominant and visually intrusive in the street and rear garden environment contrary to Policy DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Development Plan Document 2008, the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document 2011 and Policy 7.4 of the London Plan 2016.

The proposed front boundary treatments would by reason of its design and height form an unacceptably dominant and visually intrusive feature, harmful to the appearance of the street scene and detracting from the open and prevailing character of the surrounding area, contrary to the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document and Policy DC61 of LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies Plan Document.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent by e-mail on 01/04/20.
description: Erection of a single storey side and rear extensions; loft conversion incorporating a side dormer, a front porch and erection of front boundary fence with sliding gates.
